description.narrative: Core support to WWHR-New Ways Association to train women on women's human rights and support gender equality with lobbying and advocacy.

Insatsen avser kärnstöd till Women for Women Human Rights (WWHR) New Ways Association som utbildar kvinnor om kvinnors mänskliga rättigheter och arbetar för ökad jämställdhet genom lobbying och opinionsbildning.

The main target of WWHR is to support the active and broad participation of women in the establishment and maintenance of an egalitarian and peaceful social order at national, regional and international levels through a rights-based approach to promote women’s human rights in Turkey and abroad. - Description/Theory of Change In line with above mission, WWHR believes sustainable change results from:• Capacity building through training and support programs such as Women's Human Rights Education Programme(HREP), International Sexual and Bodily Rights Institutions, working groups, seminars, etc.• Networking and coalition building at different levels of the women’s movement and other rights-based movements.• Joint advocacy towards legal reforms and their implementation as well as the reinforcement of international policies and norms.• Production and Sharing of Feminist Knowledge: Documentation and promotion of feminist discourses and strategies;

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Even though the NGO has faced serious challenges countless negativities arising from the political turmoil and the government’s stance regarding gender equality it has managed to overcome these obstacles through hard and committed work in spite of these difficulties at a highly satisfactory level. Especially WWHR has managed to be very active on the objective of establishing a non-discriminatory legal framework at national and international levels (Objective 1) and has successfully contributed to many platforms and discussions on national and international level in spite of the political challenges in Turkey. WWHR continued its national and international advocacy efforts from the second quarter of 2016 onwards and during 2017. Regarding this, strengthening of legislation and standards is rendered rather impossible, especially under the current developments and circumstances during the full implementation period. However, WWHR has managed to stick to its activity plan and has contributed to this aim as much as possible and therefore the main achievement here needs to be seen as the preservation and the protection of the gains of the women activism and the current laws that safeguard and enforce women’s human rights. Especially the activism shown by WWHR and other NGOs on Article 103 of the Turkish Penal Code (TPC) should be seen as a great achievement. Also the contribution to the CEDAW and GREVIO shadow reports, inclusion to the Turkey’s 11th Development Plan discussion group, contribution to the SDG process have been very significant. Objective 2, regarding women, participating in HREP trainings at the grassroots level to have the skills and knowledge to act on their rights fulfilment and organizing, almost all activities have been realised and the outputs are mostly achieved with some lower figures due to the political constraints within ISKUR and overall in addition to the the general atmosphere. As per the same reasons explained above it will not be possible to achieve the results under this outcome however it is important to see that the activities and outcomes are being realized and the efforts are still ongoing which can be seen as positive. WWHR kept on finding new partners to work with such as municipalities and women NGOs as well as creating diversified training programs to reach more women. This innovative approach is highly appreciated. The main outputs under Objective 3, which is to reach out to people by producing and sharing feminist knowledge through increased visibility, accessibility and availability of WWHR’s materials, is rather quantitative and WWHR has managed to realise almost all of the activities and the outputs regarding the production and sharing of information. However the same problem as before, the political conditions, have also led to a high self-censorship in the media and the efforts have been conducted under this limitation. However it is still possible to say that the efforts are ongoing and some important outputs have been realized
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
